physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Fever and right chest pain. Enhanced chest CT showed exacerbation of lung suppuration with parapneumonic effusion and increased gas formation in the right middle lobe.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially presented with common cold-like symptoms and right chest pain, which progressed to lung suppuration requiring surgery.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Pathological examination showed gram-positive cocci in the cavity and cavitary wall.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative course was uneventful, and the patient was discharged in good condition. Remains asymptomatic one year after surgery.
